version.file: for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.exe') do set setup=%%x "%setup%" /S /D "%CD%"
uninstall.exe /S
for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.exe') do set setup=%%x "%setup%" /s /o /runwgacheck
mseinstall.exe /u /s

for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.exe') do set setup=%%x "%setup%" /SP- /VERYSILENT /SUPPRESSMSGBOXES /NOCANCEL /NORESTART /DIR="%CD%" /SAVEINF="%CD%\.Npackd\InnoSetupInfo.ini" /LOG="%CD%\.Npackd\InnoSetupInstall.log" set err=%errorlevel% type .Npackd\InnoSetupInstall.log if %err% neq 0 exit %err%
unins000.exe /VERYSILENT /SUPPRESSMSGBOXES /NORESTART /LOG="%CD%\.Npackd\InnoSetupUninstall.log" set err=%errorlevel% type .Npackd\InnoSetupUninstall.log if %err% neq 0 exit %err%

set onecmd="%npackd_cl%\npackdcl.exe" "path" "--package=com.googlecode.windows-package-manager.NpackdInstallerHelper" "--versions=[1.1, 2)" for /f "usebackq delims=" %%x in (`%%onecmd%%`) do set npackdih=%%x call "%npackdih%\InstallMSI.bat" TARGETDIR yes

for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.exe') do set setup=%%x "%setup%" /S /D=%CD% && del /f /q "%setup%" set err=%errorlevel% if %err% neq 0 exit /b %err% set key=org.7-zip.SevenZIP-%NPACKD_PACKAGE_VERSION% reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\Applications\%KEY%\shell\open /v FriendlyAppName /d "7-Zip File Manager (7-ZIP %NPACKD_PACKAGE_VERSION%)" /f set c=\"%CD%\7zFM.exe\" \"%%1\" reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\Applications\%KEY%\shell\open\command /d "%c%" /f for %%g in (001 7z arj bz2 bzip2 cab cpio deb dmg egg fat gz gzip hfs iso lha lzh lzma ntfs rar rpm squashfs swm tar taz tbz tbz2 tgz tpz txz vhd wim xar xz z zip) do reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\.%%g\OpenWithList\%key% /f

Uninstall.exe /S _?=%CD% set err=%errorlevel% if %err% neq 0 exit /b %err% set key=org.7-zip.SevenZIP-%NPACKD_PACKAGE_VERSION% reg delete HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\Applications\%KEY% /f for %%g in (001 7z arj bz2 bzip2 cab cpio deb dmg egg fat gz gzip hfs iso lha lzh lzma ntfs rar rpm squashfs swm tar taz tbz tbz2 tgz tpz txz vhd wim xar xz z zip) do reg delete HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\.%%g\OpenWithList\%key% /f mkdir ..\.Trash move *.dll ..\.Trash\%key%_%RANDOM% echo clear the error code
for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.exe') do set setup=%%x "%setup%" /S /D=%CD%
uninstall.exe /S _?=%CD%
call "%npackdih%\InstallMSI.bat" INSTALLLOCATION yes
[Setup] Toolbar=0

net start Spooler sc config Spooler start= auto for /f %%x in ('dir /b *.exe') do set setup=%%x "%setup%" /SP- /VERYSILENT /SUPPRESSMSGBOXES /NOCANCEL /NORESTART /DIR="%CD%" /SAVEINF="%CD%\.Npackd\InnoSetupInfo.ini" /LOG="%CD%\.Npackd\InnoSetupInstall.log" /LOADINF="%CD%\.Npackd\InnoSetupDef.ini" set err=%errorlevel% type .Npackd\InnoSetupInstall.log if %err% neq 0 exit %err%

set package=com.videolan.VLCMediaPlayer set version=%NPACKD_PACKAGE_VERSION% set key=%package%-%version% reg delete HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\Applications\%key% /f rem read extensions from the file for /f "usebackq delims=" %%a in (.Npackd\Extensions.txt) do ( set extensions=%%a goto out ) :out for %%g in (%extensions%) do reg delete HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\.%%g\OpenWithList\%key% /f

for /f %%x in ('dir /b vlc*') do set name=%%x for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b aria*') do set name=%%x cd "%name%" for /f "delims=" %%a in ('dir /b') do ( move "%%a" .. ) cd .. rmdir "%name%" set package=com.videolan.VLCMediaPlayer set version=%NPACKD_PACKAGE_VERSION% set key=%package%-%version% reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\Applications\%key%\shell\open /v FriendlyAppName /d "VLC Media Player (%version%)" /f set c=\"%CD%\vlc.exe\" \"%%1\" reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\Applications\%KEY%\shell\open\command /d "%c%" /f rem read extensions from the file for /f "usebackq delims=" %%a in (.Npackd\Extensions.txt) do ( set extensions=%%a goto out ) :out for %%g in (%extensions%) do reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\.%%g\OpenWithList\%key% /f

md "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8" md "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\brushes" md "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\dynamics" md "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\gradients" md "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\palettes" md "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\patterns" md "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\tool-presets" xcopy /y /e /q /h brushes "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\brushes\" xcopy /y /e /q /h dynamics "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\dynamics\" xcopy /y /e /q /h gradients "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\gradients\" xcopy /y /e /q /h palettes "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\palettes\" xcopy /y /e /q /h patterns "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\patterns\" xcopy /y /e /q /h tool-presets "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\tool-presets\"

rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\brushes\GPS-Brushes" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\dynamics\GPS-Eraser" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\dynamics\GPS-Fx" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\dynamics\GPS-Set1" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\dynamics\GPS-Set2" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\dynamics\GPS-Sketch" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\dynamics\GPS-Smudge" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\gradients\GPS-Grad" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\palettes\GPS-Pal" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\patterns\GPS-Pat" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\tool-presets\GPS-Eraser" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\tool-presets\GPS-Fx" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\tool-presets\GPS-Ink" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\tool-presets\GPS-Set1" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\tool-presets\GPS-Set2" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\tool-presets\GPS-Sketch" rd /s /q "%USERPROFILE%\.gimp-2.8\tool-presets\GPS-Smudge"

path for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.exe') do set setup=%%x "%setup%" /SP- /VERYSILENT /SUPPRESSMSGBOXES /NOCANCEL /NORESTART /DIR="%CD%" set err=%errorlevel% if %err% neq 0 exit /b %err% set key=org.gimp.Gimp-2.8.4 reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\Applications\%key%\shell\open /v FriendlyAppName /d "Gimp (2.8.4)" /f set c=\"%CD%\bin\gimp-2.8.exe\" \"%%1\" reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\Applications\%KEY%\shell\open\command /d "%c%" /f for %%g in (xcf pix matte mask alpha als fli flc xcf.bz2 bz2 xcfbz2 desktop dcm dicom eps fit fits g3 gif pat gbr gpb gih xcf.gz gz xcfgz jpg jpeg jpe cel ico wmf apm psp tub pspimage psd png pnm ppm pgm pbm pdf ps sgi rgb rgba bw ico im1 im8 im24 im32 rs ras svg tga vda icb vst tif tiff bmp xbm icon bitmap xpm xwd pcx pcc) do reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\.%%g\OpenWithList\%key% /f

uninst\unins000.exe /VERYSILENT /SUPPRESSMSGBOXES /NORESTART set err=%errorlevel% if %err% neq 0 exit /b %err% set key=org.gimp.Gimp-2.8.4 reg delete HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\Applications\%key% /f for %%g in (xcf pix matte mask alpha als fli flc xcf.bz2 bz2 xcfbz2 desktop dcm dicom eps fit fits g3 gif pat gbr gpb gih xcf.gz gz xcfgz jpg jpeg jpe cel ico wmf apm psp tub pspimage psd png pnm ppm pgm pbm pdf ps sgi rgb rgba bw ico im1 im8 im24 im32 rs ras svg tga vda icb vst tif tiff bmp xbm icon bitmap xpm xwd pcx pcc) do reg delete HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\.%%g\OpenWithList\%key% /f

"%ProgramFiles%\GowData\bin\wget.exe" -O wincdemu.cer http://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/x4u9hlz8o411c8w/wincdemu.cer certutil -addstore -f "TrustedPublisher" wincdemu.cer for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.exe') do set setup=%%x "%setup%" /UNATTENDED rd /s /q "%ProgramFiles%\WinCDEmu\x64" del /q /f "%ProgramFiles%\WinCDEmu\batchmnt64.exe" del /q /f "%ProgramFiles%\WinCDEmu\vmnt64.exe" del /q /f "%ProgramFiles%\WinCDEmu\uninstall64.exe"

for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.exe') do set setup=%%x "%setup%" -x -s -p "%CD%" set onecmd="%npackd_cl%\npackdcl.exe" "path" "--package=org.7-zip.SevenZIP" "--versions=[9.20, 9.20]" for /f "usebackq delims=" %%x in (`%%onecmd%%`) do set sevenzip=%%x "%sevenzip%\7z.exe" x common.cab -aos -o"%CD%\common" > .Npackd\Output.txt && type .Npackd\Output.txt "%sevenzip%\7z.exe" x "%CD%\common\file_VBoxGuestAdditions.iso" -aos -o"%CD%\common\file_VBoxGuestAdditions" > .Npackd\Output.txt && type .Npackd\Output.txt certutil.exe -addstore -f "TrustedPublisher" "%CD%\common\file_VBoxGuestAdditions\cert\oracle-vbox.cer" > .Npackd\Output.txt && type .Npackd\Output.txt for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *MultiArch_x86.msi') do set setup=%%x msiexec.exe /qn /norestart /Lime .Npackd\MSI.log /i "%setup%" set err=%errorlevel% type .Npackd\MSI.log rem 3010=restart required if %err% equ 3010 exit 0 if %err% neq 0 exit %err% for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *MultiArch_amd64.msi') do set trash=%%x del /q /f "%trash%"

for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.msi') do set setup=%%x msiexec.exe /qn /norestart /Lime .Npackd\MSI.log /x "%setup%" set err=%errorlevel% type .Npackd\MSI.log rem 3010=restart required if %err% equ 3010 exit 0 if %err% neq 0 exit %err%

for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.exe') do set setup=%%x "%setup%" /S /D=%CD% if %errorlevel% neq 0 exit /b %errorlevel% set package=net.sourceforge.NotepadPlusPlus set version=%NPACKD_PACKAGE_VERSION% set key=%package% reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\Applications\%KEY%\shell\open /v FriendlyAppName /d "Notepad++ (%version%)" /f set c=\"%CD%\notepad++.exe\" \"%%1\" reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\Applications\%KEY%\shell\open\command /d "%c%" /f for %%g in (txt log ini h hpp hxx c cpp cxx cc m java cs pas inc html htm php phtml properties js jsp asp css xml sh bsh nsi nsh lua pl pm py as mx vb vbs f for f90 f95 f2k tex sql nfo mak hgignore) do reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\.%%g\OpenWithList\%key% /f

set package=net.sourceforge.NotepadPlusPlus set version=%NPACKD_PACKAGE_VERSION% set key=%package% set newname=%key%_%random% ren %appdata%\Notepad++ %newname% uninstall.exe /S _?=%CD% if %errorlevel% neq 0 exit /b %errorlevel% ren %appdata%\%newname% Notepad++ rem unregister "Open With..." entries reg delete HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\Applications\%KEY% /f for %%g in (txt log ini h hpp hxx c cpp cxx cc m java cs pas inc html htm php phtml properties js jsp asp css xml sh bsh nsi nsh lua pl pm py as mx vb vbs f for f90 f95 f2k tex sql nfo mak hgignore) do reg delete HKLM\SOFTWARE\Classes\.%%g\OpenWithList\%key% /f rem remove Explorer extension set trash=..\.Trash\%key%_%random% mkdir %trash% move NppShell*.dll %trash% verify
for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b Console*') do set name=%%x cd "%name%" for /f "delims=" %%a in ('dir /b') do ( move "%%a" .. ) cd .. rmdir "%name%"
for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.exe') do set setup=%%x "%setup%" /S /D=%CD% && del /f /q "%setup%"
uninstall.exe /S _?=%CD%
for /f %%x in ('dir /b *.exe') do set setup=%%x "%setup%" /S /D=%CD%
uninstall.exe /S _=%CD%

for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.exe') do set setup=%%x "%setup%" /SP- /VERYSILENT /SUPPRESSMSGBOXES /NOCANCEL /NORESTART /DIR="%CD%" /SAVEINF="%CD%\.Npackd\InnoSetupInfo.ini" /LOG="%CD%\.Npackd\InnoSetupInstall.log" set err=%errorlevel% type .Npackd\InnoSetupInstall.log if %err% neq 0 exit %err%
unins000.exe /VERYSILENT /SUPPRESSMSGBOXES /NORESTART /LOG="%CD%\.Npackd\InnoSetupUninstall.log" set err=%errorlevel% type .Npackd\InnoSetupUninstall.log if %err% neq 0 exit %err%
for /f "delims=" %%x in ('dir /b *.exe') do set setup=%%x "%setup%" /S /D=%CD% && del /f /q "%setup%"
uninstall.exe /S _?=%CD%

package.name: info.kowalczyk.blog.SumatraPDF
package.title: Sumatra PDF
package.description: PDF, eBook (ePub, Mobi), XPS, DjVu, CHM, Comic Book (CBZ and CBR) reader

package.name: com.microsoft.SecurityEssentials
package.title: Security Essentials
package.description: antivirus. WARNING: at least XP SP2 is required

package.name: emet
package.title: Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit
package.description: A toolkit for deploying and configuring security mitigation technologies

package.name: org.7-zip.SevenZIP
package.title: 7-ZIP
package.description: file archiver Most of the source code is under the GNU LGPL license. The unRAR code is under a mixed license: GNU LGPL + unRAR restrictions. The main features of 7-Zip: - High compression ratio in 7z format with LZMA and LZMA2 compression - Supported formats: - Packing / unpacking: 7z, XZ, BZIP2, GZIP, TAR, ZIP and WIM - Unpacking only: ARJ, CAB, CHM, CPIO, CramFS, DEB, DMG, FAT, HFS, ISO, LZH, LZMA, MBR, MSI, NSIS, NTFS, RAR, RPM, SquashFS, UDF, VHD, WIM, XAR and Z. - For ZIP and GZIP formats, 7-Zip provides a compression ratio that is 2-10 % better than the ratio provided by PKZip and WinZip - Strong AES-256 encryption in 7z and ZIP formats - Self-extracting capability for 7z format - Integration with Windows Shell - File Manager - command line version - Plugin for FAR Manager - Localizations for 79 languages kw: 7zip

package.name: org.libreoffice.LibreOffice
package.title: LibreOffice
package.description: office suite (Writer, Calc, Impress, Draw, Math and Base)

package.name: f.lux
package.title: F.lux
package.description: WARNING: this package always installs the newest version of the software. Ever notice how people texting at night have that eerie blue glow? Or wake up ready to write down the Next Great Idea, and get blinded by your computer screen? During the day, computer screens look goodâ€”they're designed to look like the sun. But, at 9PM, 10PM, or 3AM, you probably shouldn't be looking at the sun. f.lux fixes this: it makes the color of your computer's display adapt to the time of day, warm at night and like sunlight during the day. It's even possible that you're staying up too late because of your computer. You could use f.lux because it makes you sleep better, or you could just use it just because it makes your computer look better.

package.name: ca.cypherpunks.OTRPidginPlugin
package.title: Off-the-Record Messaging plugin for Pidgin
package.description: allows you to have private conversations over instant messaging by providing: - Encryption: No one else can read your instant messages. - Authentication: You are assured the correspondent is who you think it is. - Deniability: The messages you send do not have digital signatures that are checkable by a third party. Anyone can forge messages after a conversation to make them look like they came from you. However, during a conversation, your correspondent is assured the messages he sees are authentic and unmodified. - Perfect forward secrecy: If you lose control of your private keys, no previous conversation is compromised.

package.name: net.sourceforge.mumble.Mumble
package.title: Mumble
package.description: voice chat software primarily intended for use while gaming

package.name: marble
package.title: Marble
package.description: Use Marble similar to a desktop globe; pan around and measure distances. At closer scale it becomes a world atlas, while OpenStreetMap takes you to street level. Search for places of interest, view Wikipedia articles, create routes by drag and drop and so much more.

package.name: org.torproject.Tor
package.title: Tor Browser
package.description: anonymous web browsing. WARNING: requires administrative rights every-time to start from Program Files. It could be moved to any other non-protected directory

package.name: com.peerblock.PeerBlock
package.title: PeerBlock
package.description: peer-to-peer management, firewall (block communication with advertising or spyware oriented servers, computers monitoring your p2p activities, computers which have been "hacked", even entire countries)

package.name: com.googlecode.gps-gimp-paint-studio.GPS
package.title: GPS Gimp Paint Studio
package.description: collection of brushes and accompanying tool for Gimp

package.name: imagemagick
package.title: ImageMagick
package.description: raster graphics editor used to batch process

package.name: org.winff.WinFF
package.title: WinFF
package.description: GUI for the command line video converter, FFMPEG

package.name: popcorn-time
package.title: Popcorn Time
package.description: Popcorn Time streams movies and TV shows from torrents. Downloading copyrighted material may be illegal in your country. Use at your own risk.

package.name: org.electricsheep.ElectricSheep
package.title: Electric Sheep
package.description: collaborative abstract artwork. When the computers "sleep", the Electric Sheep comes on and the computers communicate with each other by the internet to share the work of creating morphing abstract animations known as "sheep"

package.name: com.sweethome3d.SweetHome3D
package.title: Sweet Home 3D
package.description: interior design application (draw the plan of house, arrange furniture on it and visit the results in 3D)

package.name: net.nirsoft.Launcher
package.title: NirLauncher
package.description: package of more than 150 portable utilities, all of them developed for NirSoft Web site. WARNING: Microsoft Security Essentials finds 5 HackTools here

package.name: open-hardware-monitor
package.title: Open Hardware Monitor
package.description: voltages, fan speeds, temperatures, load and clock speeds monitor

package.name: org.sysprogs.WinCDEmu
package.title: WinCDEmu
package.description: CD/DVD/BD emulator. WARNING: confirmation about unsigned driver on windows XP

package.name: universal-usb-installer
package.title: Universal USB Installer
package.description: boot and run Linux from a USB flash memory stick

package.name: org.cgsecurity.testdisk.TestDisk
package.title: TestDisk & PhotoRec
package.description: command line tools for recover lost partitions, make non-booting disks bootable again, fix partition table, recover FAT32/NTFS boot sector from its backup, rebuild FAT12/FAT16/FAT32/NTFS boot sector, fix FAT tables, copy files from deleted FAT/exFAT/NTFS/ext2/ext3/ext4 partitions and etc

package.name: com.ext2fsd.ext2fsd
package.title: Ext2Fsd
package.description: an ext2/ext3 file system driver for Windows (2K/XP/VISTA/WIN7/WIN8, X86/AMD64).

package.name: com.microsoft.ProcessExplorer
package.title: Process Explorer
package.description: WARNING: this package always installs the newest version of the software. OS process viewer

package.name: org.virtualbox.virtualbox
package.title: VirtualBox
package.description: virtual machine (VM). WARNING: 4 confirmations about unsigned drivers on windows XP

package.name: meld
package.title: Meld
package.description: visual diff and merge tool targeted at developers. Meld helps you compare files, directories, and version controlled projects. It provides two- and three-way comparison of both files and directories, and has support for many popular version control systems.

package.name: pcsx2
package.title: PCSX2
package.description: PCSX2 is a Playstation 2 'emulator', a free program that tries to replicate the Playstation 2 console to enable you to play PS2 games on your PC. PCSX2 is an open source Playstation 2 emulator. Its purpose is to mimic the the PS2 hardware, using a combination of MIPS CPU Interpreters, Recompilers and a Virtual Machine which manages hardware states and PS2 system memory. Advantages over the Playstation 2 console * Custom resolutions, up to 4096x4096, Anti Aliasing and Texture filtering to make your old PS2 games look better than their HD remakes! * Unlimited memory cards * Save states, enabling you to quick save and load practically anywhere in your game * Easy cheating using our pnach patching system * Use any controller (PS3,Xbox360 etc) that works on Windows, keyboards and mice * Increase or decrease the game speed by using the built-in frame-limiter for fast grinding or passing hard spots by slowing them down * Ability to record in full HD with the built-in video recorder (F12 using the GSdx plugin)
